derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin investitura, from investire (see invest)

entry.def: An investiture is a ceremony in which someone is given an official title.

example.ex: ...Edward VIII's investiture as Prince of Wales in 1911.
example.tran: 爱德华八世 1911 年被封为威尔士亲王的仪式

means.word_mean: 1. the ceremony of installing a new monarch
2. the ceremonial act of clothing someone in the insignia of an office; the formal promotion of a person to an office or rank
